Ad Text:
Job description


Senior V&V Systems Engineer

At BAE Systems Australia

Do interesting work that MATTERS
ENJOY what you do
GROW your career
Be YOU

We work in a thriving sector – one that puts us at the forefront of exciting and meaningful work. Every day we push boundaries to produce some of the world's most innovative and groundbreaking technology. Individually we all contribute to our success. Collectively we make the impossible possible.

Recognised for delivering projects of global and national significance that help keep Australia safe, it is our shared passion that shapes our culture, and our people that make it a great place to work.

About the OPPORTUNITY

The MQ-28 Ghost Bat is a cost-effective, semi-attritable autonomous uncrewed air vehicle developed with Boeing, with BAE Systems contributing advanced autonomy and systems integration expertise. As part of the Systems Team, the successful applicant—reporting to the Systems Engineering Lead—will lead end-to-end Verification and Validation (V&V) activities and collaborate with software and algorithm teams to develop and refine BAE Systems' components of the platform.

This role can be based in Adelaide SA or Melbourne VIC

Key responsibilities include:

Lead the development and execution of Verification & Validation (V&V) strategies, plans, and system tests to ensure alignment with program goals and compliance with aerospace standards.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure safe, feasible, and traceable verification methods, and validate system models to support decision-making.
Define and lead validation of system models (e.g. simulation, analytical, digital twins) to ensure they accurately represent the real-world system and can support formal verification and decision-making
Manage risks, resolve test anomalies, and maintain configuration control to uphold the integrity of all V&V work products.
Represent V&V in engagements with stakeholders, customers, and regulatory bodies, while driving continuous improvement in tools and processes.

About YOU

A University degree-level engineering qualification preferably within a Systems, Electronics, Software or Mechatronics discipline
Strong knowledge of systems engineering processes across the full lifecycle, with emphasis on verification and validation.
Proven experience leading V&V for aerospace or defence software-intensive systems, including planning, execution, and issue resolution.
Proficient in systems engineering tools like DOORS and CAMEO, with hands-on MBSE experience.
Experience in uncrewed systems development is desirable.
Chartered Professional Engineer status is preferred.
Defence security clearance or eligibility to obtain
Eligibility to be cleared for International Traffic In Arms (ITAR) regulations

We believe in hiring for potential, we know that some candidates f they don't tick all the boxes.  If this role interests you, but you don't meet all the criteria, we still encourage you to apply.

About US

You will be joining a workplace that truly cares about your wellbeing.

Our people are diverse and we value the variety of perspectives this brings, we know that a culture that is inclusive and fosters a sense of belonging is a place we can all make the most of our unique talents and be our best.

As Australia's largest defence company in a rapidly growing sector, you will be connected into a global team and encouraged to explore where your career might take you whether that is a traditional career path or squiggly one, there are infinite possibilities for you at BAE Systems Australia. 

BAE Systems recognises the sacrifices of those who have served our Nation and their families.  We support our veteran community through our internal veteran network (VetNet Australia) and strong charitable partnerships, internal offerings including reserve service leave, a Veteran Mentoring Program and other exclusive offerings available through our strategic partners.

We welcome applicants from all people regardless of sex, gender identity, race, ethnicity, disability, pregnancy, age, or other lived experience; and strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people for all positions.

We are proud to be recognised as an employer of choice for women by WORK180.

Awarded the 2024 Quarter 1 Benchmarcx Triple R- Excellence In Candidate Experience Certification. As a member of the Circle Back Initiative we commit to respond to every applicant.

To learn more about our employee benefits, flexibility, other employment opportunities and what to expect from our recruitment process please visit: www.baesystemscareers.com.au

Clearances

As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and either possess or be eligible to obtain and maintain appropriate clearances. Further information regarding security clearances.

Company Description


Lendi Group is a market-leading digital platform business that is focused on revolutionising the entire property journey. It operates Lendi - Australia’s original and #1 digital mortgage brand - and the iconic Aussie franchise.

Powered by an advanced AI proprietary platform, a national network of 1,300 brokers, 230 retail stores, a team of experienced buyer’s agents, integrated property search and conveyancing, Aussie is supporting customers at every step of their property journey to find, buy and own with more confidence than ever before. Lendi Group’s loan book is more than $100b and it was named Australia’s Aggregator of the Year for 2024.

To learn more about life at Lendi Group check out our blog: https://www.lendi.com.au/inspire/category/life-at-lendi/

Why Join Us?

Innovation at Our Core – We challenge the status quo and push boundaries to create better solutions.
Work with the Best – Collaborate with some of the brightest minds in fintech, financial services, and strategy.
Make an Impact – Contribute to meaningful projects that shape our business and the future of property finance.
Grow & Evolve – Develop your skills and advance your career in a fast-moving, purpose-driven environment.

Job Description


The Head of Engineering at Lendi Group leads and oversees all cross-functional engineering teams, driving the technical vision, strategy, and execution to deliver innovative solutions that transform the mortgage lending experience.

This role will play a key role in shaping the Lendi Group platform roadmap, ensuring alignment with business objectives, scalability, and reliability.  By leading through example, the role empowers teams to deliver high-quality software products that exceed customer expectations. 

People 

Provide strategic leadership and direction to all engineering team leaders, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and innovation. 
Serve as a mentor and coach to aspiring leaders within the engineering organization, providing guidance and support in their career development journey. 
Lead the recruitment, hiring, and retention efforts to build diverse and high-performing engineering teams. 
Serve as a mentor and coach to aspiring leaders within the engineering organization, providing guidance and support in their career development journey. Lead by example, mentoring and coaching engineering team leaders to grow their skills, capabilities, and career development opportunities. 

Tech 

Define and execute Lendi's engineering strategy, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives. 
Collaborate with GM of Tech to establish and enforce engineering best practices, standards, and processes to ensure quality, scalability, and reliability across all products and services. 
Collaborate with Architects to drive technical excellence and innovation by evaluating emerging technologies, tools, and methodologies and advocating for their adoption when appropriate. 
Oversee the architecture, design, development, testing, and deployment of software solutions, ensuring adherence to timelines and budgets. 

Delivery 

Partner closely with product management, design, and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions that deliverers actual business and customer value. 
Champion Agile and DevOps practices, fostering a culture of continuous integration, delivery, and improvement. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address technical debt, scalability bottlenecks, and performance issues. 
Take the lead in establishing cross-team working groups aimed at promoting collaboration among teams across different supergroups and relevant divisions for both technical and product initiatives. 

Qualifications


Leadership experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; Master's degree preferred. 
Leadership & Team Management: 
Extensive experience managing and leading leaders of cross-functional engineering teams. 
Demonstrated track record of unwavering accountability within team dynamics, ensuring ownership of outcomes even in collaborative environments. 
Proven ability to recruit, hire, and develop top engineering talent, fostering a culture of learning and growth. 
Commitment to the career growth and development of team members, with consistently strong 360 feedback ratings. 
Proficiency in conflict resolution techniques, including coaching and mediation, to ensure team cohesion. 
Experience identifying and intervening in instances of decreased team engagement or performance in a timely manner. 
Extensive experience in proactive headcount and engineering resource planning aligned with the product roadmap and broader business objectives. 

Technical experience: 

Strong technical background with expertise in software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum), modern development languages, and frameworks. 
Extensive experience in solution architecture and delivery, with a proven ability to design scalable, resilient, and secure systems. 
Demonstrated success in fostering productive partnerships with stakeholders such as Product Managers, Business Analysts, and Designers. 
Strong adherence to established processes, with a proactive approach to identifying and rectifying deficiencies. 
Demonstrated ability to drive technical change, build consensus, and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization. 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Emerging Technologies: 

Proven experience in applying AI and machine learning for both solution delivery (e.g., intelligent automation, personalization, data-driven insights) and software development (e.g., AI-assisted coding, quality assurance, and DevOps tooling). 
Demonstrated ability to integrate AI technologies into products, platforms, or processes to create measurable business impact. 
Strong understanding of AI development frameworks, APIs, and cloud-based AI/ML services (AWS, Azure, GCP, or equivalent). 
Experience leading teams in the responsible adoption of AI, with a focus on ethics, bias mitigation, and compliance. 

Other: 

Knowledge of financial service industry, including its regulatory requirements and compliance standards is a plus. 

Additional Information


Lendi Group teams operate across Australia and the Philippines. Bringing together diverse expertise, innovative technology and a customer-first approach, our teams work seamlessly to simplify the property journey, helping Australians find, buy and own property with confidence.

We support our people in a variety of ways, but a few of the benefits that our people rave about include:

A vibrant, relaxed, yet professional culture.
Hybrid working arrangement designed to support work-life balance, while fostering meaningful connection and collaboration.
A holistic wellbeing programs offering 24/7 support, including medical, mental health, and financial wellbeing services to enable our workforce to thrive at home and work.
Generous paid Parental Leave: we celebrate our growing Lendi Group family with 18-26 weeks leave for primary carers and up to 4 weeks for secondary carers.
An additional week’s Loyalty Leave each year after reaching 3 years’ service.
Wellness initiatives with a strong focus on psychological safety.

We’re committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive community at Lendi Group. We believe that a team reflecting the world around us leads to greater innovation, stronger collaboration, and a more engaging workplace.

Our culture is guided by our 3 core values: We Are Stronger United; Act Like You Own It; and Keep Home Loans Human. Our values are part of our core DNA that helps Lendi Group to attract, engage and evolve the right talent and build best-in-class products.

This is an opportunity to shape the future of a fast-growing, purpose-driven company that’s transforming the homeownership journey.

Ready to contribute to Lendi Group’s next chapter? Apply now and be part of something big!

#lendigroup #LI-GR2 #LI-hybrid

DLA Piper is seeking a skilled and forward-thinking Reliability Engineer to join a growing international team. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of software engineering, DevOps, and infrastructure reliability. Supporting large-scale distributed systems across the Aisa-Pacific regions, Europe, the UK, the Middle East and Africa.

Collaborating closely with colleagues in EMEA, you will be responsible for ensuring high availability, performance, and scalability of our systems. You will work closely with the Platform and Product teams to automate infrastructure, streamline CI/CD processes, and proactively monitor system health.

Maid duties and responsibilities

Design and implement automation across infrastructure and applications

Monitor system performance and reliability, responding to alerts and incidents

Collaborate on system design, capacity planning, and platform management

Build sustainable systems through automation and uplift initiatives

Drive improvements in operational processes and team practices

Lead fault detection, remediation, and performance tuning

About you

Proficiency in programming languages (Python, Java, C++, Ruby, JavaScript)

Experience with cloud infrastructure and distributed storage (e.g., NFS, HDFS, Ceph)

Familiarity with resource management frameworks (e.g., Kubernetes, Apache Mesos)

Strong troubleshooting skills and a proactive approach to performance optimisation

Experience with CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, and incident response

Ability to influence and collaborate across teams and senior stakeholders

About us

We're a global law firm helping our clients achieve their goals wherever they do business. Our pursuit of innovation has transformed our delivery of legal services. With offices in the Americas, Europe, the Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific, we deliver exceptional outcomes on cross-border projects, critical transactions and high-stakes disputes.

At DLA Piper, we understand that inclusion is not a one-size-fits-all concept. We embrace and celebrate the range of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences that each individual brings to our firm. By fostering a culture that welcomes and appreciates all aspects of our individuality, we ensure that everyone has the opportunity to succeed.

Our commitment to inclusion and positive social impact enables us to provide exceptional service to our clients and communities, while nurturing a unique and inclusive culture for all our people. We welcome the unique contribution that you will bring to our firm and actively encourage applications from all talented people – however your talent is packaged, whatever your background or circumstance and regardless of how you identify.

We are committed to being accessible and accommodating any reasonable adjustments needed throughout the recruitment process to ensure an inclusive experience for all. If you need any support or adjustments, please let us know.

Where local legislation permits, we will conduct relevant pre-engagement screening checks prior to your first day.
